scigenex 2.0.8

Reference

All functions

ClusterSet-class

ClusterSet-class

call_infomap_clusterset()

Perform Community Detection Using the infomap Algorithm (internal function)

call_louvain_clusterset()

Perform Community Detection Using the Louvain Algorithm (internal function)

call_walktrap_clusterset()

Perform Community Detection Using the Walktrap Algorithm (internal function)

centers(<ClusterSet>)

Extract centers from a ClusterSet object.

check_format_cluster_set()

Check the format of a Clusterset object

clust_names(<ClusterSet>)

The names of the gene clusters stored in the ClusterSet object

clust_size(<ClusterSet>)

Sizes of the clusters stored in a ClusterSet object clust_size

cluster_set_from_matrix()

Transform any matrix and list into a ClusterSet object.

cluster_set_from_seurat()

Transform a Seurat objects / FindAllMarkers result into a ClusterSet.

cluster_set_report()

Create a report from a ClusterSet and Seurat object. DEPRECATED

cluster_set_to_xls(<ClusterSet>)

Write Cluster-Set gene lists into an excel sheet.

cluster_stats(<ClusterSet>)

Compute statistics about the clusters

cmp_to_a_list()

Map a user list to a ClusterSet and display various metrics related to overlap with internaly stored clusters

col_names(<ClusterSet>)

Column names of a ClusterSet object.

colors_for_gradient()

Generate a vector of colors for a gradient

compare_genesets()

Compare two lists of gene sets

complex9

The Complex9 dataset A set of 2D points corresponding to 9 shapes.

complex9Noisy

The complex9Noisy dataset A noisy version of the complex9 dataset. A set of 2D points corresponding to 9 shapes embedded in a noisy environment. A uniform noise was added to the dataset.

compute_centers(<ClusterSet>)

Compute centers of gene modules (e.g mean profiles)

create_3_rnd_clust()

Generate an example dataset with three clusters of profiles

create_4_rnd_clust()

Generate an example dataset with four clusters of profiles

create_rand_str()

Generate a random string of letters and numbers

discrete_palette()

Generate a discrete color palette

display_hull()

Draw a hull around a region of interest of Visium data.

do_closest_neighbor_graph()

Construct a new graph for a ClusterSet object (internal)

do_reciprocal_neighbor_graph()

Construct a graph based on selected genes in a ClusterSet object and their neighbors

enrich_go(<ClusterSet>)

Enrichment analysis using GO database of gene clusters from a ClusterSet object

filter_by_dot_prod()

Filter cluster from a ClusterSet object using dot product.

filter_cluster_sd()

Filter out gene clusters with small standard deviation.

filter_cluster_size()

Filter out gene clusters containing few genes

filter_nb_supporting_cells()

Filter out cluster supported by few cells.

gene_cluster(<ClusterSet>)

The gene clusters stored in a ClusterSet. gene_cluster

gene_clustering()

Gene clustering using the Markov Cluster Algorithm (MCL) method.

getFlippedTissueCoordinates()

Seurat object internally store spot coordinates (see Seurat::GetTissueCoordinates()). However, at least in the case of Visium, data are flipped and rotated before SpatialDimPlot. This function return the rotated/flipped tissue Coordinates from a Seurat object.

get_data_for_scigenex()

Fetch an expression matrix from a file, dataframe or Seurat object.

get_genes()

Extract genes list from each gene clusters.

get_verbosity()

Get the current verbosity level.

gm_report()

Create a report from a ClusterSet and Seurat objects

grep_clust(<ClusterSet>)

Search gene module using a regular expression.

install_mcl()

Install MCL

load_example_dataset()

Load/download a Seurat or ClusterSet example dataset.

lymph_node_selected_spot

The lymph_node_selected_spot dataset

lymph_node_selected_spot

The lymph_node_selected_spot dataset (#2)

mcl_system_cmd()

Call MCL program for graph partitioning (internal).

module_quality_scores(<ClusterSet>)

Compute Gene Module Quality Scores

nclust(<ClusterSet>)

Number of clusters in a ClusterSet object. nclust

plot_clust_enrichments(<ClusterSet>)

Plot Cluster Enrichments

plot_cluster_stats()

Plot the result of cluster_stats()

plot_cmp_genesets()

Plot the result of compare_genesets

plot_dist()

Plot Distribution of distances

plot_ggheatmap(<ClusterSet>)

Heatmap of data contained in a ClusterSet object.

plot_heatmap()

plot_heatmap

plot_markers_to_clusters(<ClusterSet>)

Map cell markers to clusters (hypergeometric/jaccard)

plot_multi_profiles()

Plot a summarized view of expression profiles.

plot_profiles()

Plot mean expression profiles of each cluster from a ClusterSet object.

plot_spatial()

XY scatter plot of Visium data with hexagonal spots.

plot_spatial_panel()

A planel of XY scatter plots of Visium data with hexagonal spots.

plot_stratum()

Display the results of stratify_seurat

print_msg()

Print a message based on the level of verbosity

print_stat()

Debugging statistics (vector, matrix or dataframe)

reload_pac()

Reload scigenex (used for development).

rename_clust(<ClusterSet>)

Rename the gene clusters of a ClusterSet

reorder_clust(<ClusterSet>)

Reorder the clusters from a ClusterSet

reorder_genes(<ClusterSet>)

Reorder genes in a ClusterSet object.

row_names(<ClusterSet>)

Row names of a ClusterSet object. row_names

select_genes()

Selects informative genes based on k-nearest neighbour analysis.

set_verbosity()

Set the verbosity level for the SciGeneX package

show_methods()

List the method for the ClusterSet object.

stratify_seurat()

Given two spot groups, compute for each spot: (i) the distance of the closest spot in the other class.

subsample_by_ident(<ClusterSet>)

Given ncell, a target number, select ncell from each class of cell/column.

top_by_go(<ClusterSet>)

Select top_genes based on go terms

top_by_grep(<ClusterSet>)

Select top_genes based on a regular expression search

top_by_intersect(<ClusterSet>)

Select top_genes based on intersection with a list.

top_genes(<ClusterSet>)

Most co-expressed genes from each gene cluster

viz_enrich(<ClusterSet>)

Visualization of enrichment analyses results from a ClusterSet object

which_clust(<ClusterSet>)

Which clusters contain a set of genes.

write_clust(<ClusterSet>)

Write the cluster to files.
